subtitles.transcript: When I go to Sacramento and talk to legislators, none of them say, “I came to Sacramento to cut funding for UC and CSU.”
But what they say is, “We had to do it because we had budget problems and higher education
was one of the few areas where we could actually cut and then not lose either equivalent federal funds,
not break a constitutional mandate, not violate financing for special funds, not contradict a court order” –
and there are all kinds of other segments of the state’s governance where those factors play a role.
